Extracts a custom-built, powerful handgun from a secured steel box labeled 'THE GOOD SAMARITAN'.

Jokes about not taking hints, referencing emotional resilience despite personal setbacks.

Instructs Myers on how to load the tracking bullet and takes initiative to shoot Sammael relentlessly to protect others.

Admits 'Hey! Hey! I'm on your side!!' to train driver while being attacked, showing situational awareness and attempt to de-escalate.
Follows glowing trail of goop to track enemy after nearly being crushed, demonstrating persistence and tracking skill.

Successfully defeats a dangerous enemy through a combination of physical skill and clever improvisation.
Walks away from the battle rather than lingering, indicating focus and situational awareness.

Turns off his belt locator and moves away into the darkness of the tunnel despite warnings.

Snatches a six-pack of beer from a young couple in the park while smiling.
Brings beer to Liz at the mental hospital despite her being a patient, showing a personal gesture of care.
Sits next to Liz and expresses that he misses her and wants her to come back, showing emotional concern and sincerity.

Minimizes his injury by calling it 'just a scratch' and downplays the need for medical attention.
Smiles sadly and respects Liz's wish to leave, showing understanding and care.

Drops to his knees and allows friends to help him up, implicitly trusting those around him.
Focuses on Liz with a sense of emotional pain, indicating strong feelings and personal investment in others.

Jokes weakly with Myers despite feeling light-headed and obviously injured.

Mocking Myers with nickname 'pamcakes' and questioning his expertise, in a teasing but not harsh way.

Tears after a fleeing figure with gun in hand despite warning to wait.
Tears after the fleeing figure immediately with gun in hand, showing quick reaction and pursuit.

Sits and studies Abe in a trance-like state, indicating concern and focus.

Insists on accompanying Liz instead of letting Myers go; shows confidence in wanting to protect or be involved.
Sits back down, refuses to eat, folds the paper dismissively, and snaps at Myers; shows emotional reaction overriding diplomacy.

Corrects Myers about Liz's coffee preference confidently.

Chuckles trying to feel superior but his smile fades when Liz gestures vigorously.

Sits quietly with the pigeon kid, listens to his advice despite dismissing it lightly.
Shakes his head at the kid's suggestion, showing reluctance to open up about his feelings.

Refuses to take simplistic advice from a child about expressing feelings, indicating self-awareness and maturity.

Remains silent, withdrawn, not eating or sleeping for three days after Broom's death.

Takes Liz's decision seriously and responds with openness and honesty about his own feelings.

Takes a moment to open up emotionally and communicate honestly about his feelings and insecurities.

Promises he won't give up on Liz, despite his own insecurities about his appearance.
Promises to never give up on Liz and expresses confidence despite personal insecurities.
Explains the nature of the threat clearly and pragmatically to his team, showing concern for their understanding and safety.

Motions for silence when sensing danger, indicating situational awareness and cautious approach.

Expresses frustration with 'Son of a --' but quickly continues action without hesitation or confusion.
Despite dangerous traps and hostile environment, continues forward instead of retreating as Manning suggests.
Does not heed Manning's suggestion to go back and breaks with protocol by insisting to proceed.
Protects Manning by using his stone fist as a shield against Kroenen's attack.

Expresses personal motivation and anger by saying 'You killed my father' during the fight.
Fights fiercely and decisively to protect himself and Manning from Kroenen.
Snatches Manning's hand to help him during the fall, supports him on his back while climbing up.
Brutally yanks Kroenen into the pit, causing likely fatal injury.
Uses the rope as a lasso while climbing up with Manning on his back, showing resourcefulness and physical skill.
Wraps the rope around his stone fist and yanks Kroenen into the spike pit, demonstrating tactical thinking and strength.
Remains calm and observant after climbing out, noting his enemy's blade and prosthetic hand.

Kneels down to check on Manning and asks if he is okay.

Promises to find a way out and come back for Manning.

Tends to Manning's injuries and offers reassurance, showing situational awareness and leadership.
Decides to find a way out alone while instructing Manning to stay put, demonstrating confidence and tactical thinking.

Pounds the floor furiously and calls out to Liz and Myers to reassure them he is coming to help.
Labors up a steep slope using rocks and roots for handholds, attempting to reach trapped teammates.
Pounds the floor furiously to warn and help Liz and Myers trapped below.
Reaches a dead end and collapses, out of breath, unable to proceed further.
Crashes through ceiling to save Liz and Myers, saying 'Sorry. Just couldn't leave you two alone.'
Scoops up Myers and deposits him next to Liz, helping them to safety.
Crashes through the ceiling to crush a creature beneath a ton of stone, showing physical power and decisive intervention.
Scoops up Myers and deposits him next to Liz, actively protecting allies and helping regroup.

Despite multiple creatures attacking and biting, he continues to fight back, demonstrating resilience and determination.

Refuses to open the door despite the promise of saving Liz, showing his resolve not to betray his principles.
Shows intense anguish at Liz's death and fights to free himself to help her.
Studies the stone sculpture and his own right hand carefully before acting, showing awareness and contemplation.
Refuses to open the door despite the emotional blackmail and pressure, showing mental strength and resolve.
Struggles physically to free himself, successfully snapping one cuff and attacking Ilsa, beginning to regain control.
His rage builds but the yoke does not bend, indicating a physical limitation or inability to break free easily.
Drops his gaze and whispers 'For her' when pressured, showing concern for someone else.
Closes his eyes and repeats his true name to become the key, accepting his role despite inner conflict.
Becomes intoxicated with power and smiles with supreme arrogance as horns burst forth.
Inserts his paw into the first imprint on the stone slab, unlocking an ominous power despite warnings.
Struggles to find an answer when pressured, drops his gaze, speaks in a hoarse whisper, showing uncertainty and lack of confidence.
Obeys Grigory's command to repeat his true name and becomes the key, activating his powers in a ritualistic way.
Demonstrates physical strength and supernatural power by inserting his paw into the stone slab and turning it like a lock, successfully unleashing a powerful beam of light.
Becomes inebriated with power and displays supreme arrogance, potentially indicating overconfidence without prudence.
Clobbers Ilsa full in the face to protect Myers and stops the ritual.
Snaps off his own horns in agony and uses them to stab Grigory, stopping the final seal.
Throws away the rosary that smokes in his hand, near explosive belts.
Thrusts his hand into the second imprint and turns it, actively progressing towards opening the final seal.
Catches the rosary instinctively when thrown to him, demonstrating alertness and quick reflexes.
Tosses the smoking, charred rosary away near explosives, indicating situational awareness and judgment.
Snaps off his horns and uses one as a weapon to stab Grigory, showing resourcefulness, decisiveness, and effective combat skill.
Fails to prevent the final seal from being opened, which unleashes a dangerous evil, indicating possible failure or unintended consequence.
Breaks Myers' chains and helps him up.
Painfully takes Liz's limp body in his arms, kisses her forehead, and caresses her hair.
Carefully hands Liz's body over to Myers, telling him to keep her safe.
Carefully hands Liz’s body over to Myers, instructs him to keep her safe no matter what.
Insists on facing the threat alone despite danger, underestimates the size of the danger.
Cradles Liz's head and holds her against his chest, whispering comforting words promising to protect her.
Lovingly caresses Liz's hair.
Wraps explosive belts around his stone arm and deliberately pulls the pins despite knowing it will hurt, demonstrating calculated bravery and tactical use of his abilities.
Endures extreme physical pain and damage (being swallowed, burning inside the creature, landing with a bone-crunching thud) yet continues to stand and move forward.
Successfully causes a chain reaction that destroys the creature Behemoth, showing effective problem-solving and execution.
After the battle, despite injury and pain, drags himself forward to attend to Liz and comforts her, showing emotional strength combined with physical resilience.
Speaks decisively and with conviction to supernatural entities to protect Liz, indicating confidence and command over difficult situations.
